timeline.bodyText: if you put dynamic before value then for consistency we should have String before key
timeline.author: agilob

replies.bodyText: Due to implicit-dynamic: false, you always have to be explicit about dynamic. But the String key is inferred.
replies.author: kuhnroyal

timeline.bodyText: i see that there's no implicit-casts:false in this one, maybe thats the difference between mine and your usage?
timeline.author: Grohden
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1 +1,6 @@
-analyzer:
\ No newline at end of file
+analyzer:
+  language:
+    strict-inference: true
+    strict-raw-types: true
+  strong-mode:
+    implicit-dynamic: false

replies.bodyText: You are right, I just commented on your PR.
replies.author: kuhnroyal

timeline.message:
[dart-dio] Add dartanalyzer to integration tests

* raise minimum Dart version to 2.6 (to support spread collection)
* add header to all files for language version
* fix some missing imports that can be fixed (some remain due to missing inheritance support)

[dart-dio] Enable strong-mode and strict types

This will make it easier to eventually transition to NNBD. Also fix some formatting things.
[dart-dio] Add implicit-casts: false to analysis options

[dart-dio] Add dartanalyzer to integration tests

* raise minimum Dart version to 2.6 (to support spread collection)
* add header to all files for language version
* fix some missing imports that can be fixed (some remain due to missing inheritance support)

* raise minimum Dart version to 2.6 (to support spread collection)
* add header to all files for language version
* fix some missing imports that can be fixed (some remain due to missing inheritance support)
